this was all done on a white board so

now it turns out that actually doing

if you're a football captain of your

I used to remember when map used to come

turns out that 5 a.m.

we come up with this idea on a

instead so when it comes to starting

those ideas that seem theoretically

so well my third lesson is about
focusing on momentum now when I first

I thought that we'd get from the start

I think about the story that we've had

just spend hours discussing the smallest

for you know capturing this huge vision
we had limited time and limited resource
and so we thought we can't afford to

what turned out was that rather than

but just a much slower one this is
something that's happened so many times
I actually struggle to come up with even

you do it so often that you know you
can't even remember what you ate

realized that these mistakes are bound

you should try and embrace them instead
instead of agonizing over each and every

do or whether something is the right

just getting from a standstill to
something at all so I'd say it's better
to start doing the wrong thing than to
not start at all
my last lesson is about being an

so I'll explain first otherwise I'll
just confuse you all the cockroach is

I remember Sam Altman giving us one of

he said that starting a business is like

you can hang on long enough you're bound
to succeed it turns out that holding
onto that wave is one of the hardest
